artist: Artist: Natori Shunsen; Publisher: Watanabe Shōzaburō
creditline: Gift of Ellen and Fred Wells
description: head and shoulders of man holding up a sword with a blue handle; white kimono with green, yellow and brown organic design
markings: red artist\'s seal: 岱紫洞主 {Taishi Dōshu} | publisher seal: 渡辺工 {Watanabe kō} (work of Watanabe) | LRC, artist\'s hand-applied red approval seal: 名取 {Natori}
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper with mica and embossing
portfolio: From Creative Prints: Collected Portraits by Shunsen (Sōsaku hanga: Shunsen nigao-e shū 創作版画　春仙似顔画集)
text: Twenty-ninth design of a set of 36. Actor Bandō Hikosaburō  VI (1886-1938) as Matsuōmaru in the scene "Kurumabiki" (Tearing the Carriage Apart) of the kabuki drama "Sugawara denju tenarai kagami" 菅原伝授手習鑑 (Mirror of Learning and Transmitting Sugawara's Secrets of Calligraphy).
title: Actor Bandō Hikosaburō  VI as Matsuōmaru
